 A series of practical tutorials for managing Open Research Data and adhere as much as possible to the [FAIR principles](https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/). Our tutorials provide guidelines, step-by-step instructions, examples and code to facilitate the following components of **data curation**.


### Explore All Tutorials
The dendrogram below shows a content summary. Use the left side bar to go to the different tutorials or scroll down and use the table below. 

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| code-fold: true
#| echo: false


library(collapsibleTree)

 # Read data 
 AFFORD <- read.csv('Tutorials_tree.csv')

  # Plot dendrogram 
 collapsibleTree(AFFORD, 
                root = 'Tutorials',
                hierarchy = c("Topic", 'Output','Description'),  
              maxPercent = 50,
                fill = c('black',
                 rep("forestgreen", 1), 
                 rep("darkmagenta", 1), 
                 rep("lightgreen", 2),
                 rep("plum", 3),
                 rep("floralwhite", 7)
                  ), 
                 collapsed = FALSE, zoomable = FALSE, fontSize = 13, width='90%')
```

<!-- | File and folder names | What convention is followed in the names of your files and folders. Include a description of what the filename parts and a schematic of the folder structure when relevant.                                                          | -->
